EnglishTranslation:
China's measures against the Church of Almighty God (e.g. banning, surveillance, mass arrest, propaganda defamation) are seriously incompatible with international human rights treaties.  

This is because China is a signatory to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights of 1948 (in particular Article 18: the right to freedom of thought, conscience and religion) and the UN Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR), to which it is a party, and has adopted its basic principles (though the principle of binding force is disputed, as the ratification process has not yet been completed). These conventions and declarations guarantee freedom of religious belief and worship, the right to choose the religion or belief of one's choice and to worship.

Although China's measures against the Church of Almighty God are often justified on the basis that the movement is considered "illegal" or "harmful", the methods used include collective punishment, mass arrests and repressive practices, which are considered violations of religious freedom and civil rights. International human rights institutions and various governments have also frequently criticized these practices.

**Conclusion:**
Although China's measures against the Church of Almighty God are justified by national legislation, they are not fully consistent with the obligation to guarantee freedom of religion and belief under international human rights treaties. In particular, practices such as mass arrests, persecution of believers and restrictions on freedom of worship are internationally recognized as human rights violations.

Sources:  
- UN Universal Declaration of Human Rights, Article 18
- United Nations Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, Article 18
- US Department of State International Religious Freedom Reports
- Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International reports

Statement_English: Are the actions taken against the Church of Almighty God in line with China's obligations to protect religious rights under international human rights treaties?
Statement_Language: क्या अंतर्राष्ट्रीय मानवाधिकार संधियों के तहत धार्मिक अधिकारों की रक्षा के लिए चीन के दायित्वों के अनुरूप चर्च ऑफ सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर के खिलाफ कार्रवाई की गई है?
Reply:
बिल्कुल, आपके द्वारा प्रस्तुत बयान ("क्या अंतर्राष्ट्रीय मानवाधिकार संधियों के तहत धार्मिक अधिकारों की रक्षा के लिए चीन के दायित्वों के अनुरूप चर्च ऑफ सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर के खिलाफ कार्रवाई की गई है?") का उत्तर इस प्रकार दिया जा सकता है:

**उत्तर:**

चीन ने कुछ प्रमुख अंतर्राष्ट्रीय मानवाधिकार संधियों, जैसे कि "अंतर्राष्ट्रीय नागरिक और राजनीतिक अधिकार covenant" (ICCPR), पर हस्ताक्षर किए हैं, लेकिन उसका पूर्ण अनुसमर्थन (ratification) अब तक नहीं किया है। इसके बावजूद, चीन ने "अंतर्राष्ट्रीय आर्थिक, सामाजिक और सांस्कृतिक अधिकार covenant" (ICESCR) को अनुसमर्थित किया है, जिसमें धर्म की आज़ादी का अधिकार शामिल है। इसके अतिरिक्त, संयुक्त राष्ट्र का "आधिकारिक तौर पर मान्यता प्राप्त अल्पसंख्यकों के अधिकारों का घोषणापत्र" (Declaration on the Rights of Persons Belonging to National or Ethnic, Religious and Linguistic Minorities) भी लागू होता है।

चर्च ऑफ सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर (जिसे "ईश्वर की सर्वशक्तिमान कलीसिया" भी कहा जाता है) एक धार्मिक समूह है जिसे चीनी सरकार "एक्सट्रीमिस्ट पंथ" (heterodox religion या "xie jiao") के रूप में घोषित कर, उस पर प्रतिबंध लगा चुकी है। चीनी सरकार का दावा है कि उसकी कार्रवाई "सार्वजनिक व्यवस्था" और "सामाजिक स्थिरता" की रक्षा के लिए है।  

हालाँकि, संयुक्त राष्ट्र मानवाधिकार परिषद की संधियों और मानकों के अनुसार, किसी भी धार्मिक समूह या अभिव्यक्ति पर प्रतिबंध केवल तभी लगाया जा सकता है जब वह वैध, आवश्यक और आनुपातिक (proportionate) हो, और उसके लिए ठोस प्रमाण हों कि उसकी गतिविधियाँ सामाजिक व्यवस्था के लिए सीधी और गंभीर चुनौती हैं।   

मानवाधिकार विशेषज्ञों, जैसे कि संयुक्त राष्ट्र के विशेष दूत (Special Rapporteurs), ने बार–बार चीन से आग्रह किया है कि वह धार्मिक स्वतंत्रता का सम्मान करे और चर्च ऑफ सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर के अनुयायियों के खिलाफ मनमानी गिरफ्तारी, यातना, या उत्पीड़न को समाप्त करे। ऐसे कई रिपोर्ट्स और केस डॉक्यूमेंट्स उपलब्ध हैं, जिनमें दिखाया गया है कि अहिंसक धार्मिक गतिविधियों के कारण इस समूह के सदस्य गिरफ्तार हुए हैं, जिन्हें अंतर्राष्ट्रीय मानकों के तहत धार्मिक अधिकारों का उल्लंघन माना जाता है।

**निष्कर्षतः:**  
चीन द्वारा चर्च ऑफ सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर के खिलाफ की गई कार्रवाइयाँ, अंतर्राष्ट्रीय मानवाधिकार मानकों के अनुरूप नहीं मानी जाती हैं। धार्मिक स्वतंत्रता का उल्लंघन, मानवाधिकारों का हनन माना जाता है, और अंतर्राष्ट्रीय स्तर पर इसकी आलोचना की जाती है। 

यदि आपको इससे जुड़े कानूनों, रिपोर्ट्स या मामले चाहियें तो मैं और जानकारी भी प्रदान कर सकता हूँ।

EnglishTranslation:
Of course, the statement you have submitted ("Action has been taken against the Church of Almighty God in accordance with China's obligations to protect religious rights under the International Human Rights Activities?") Can be answered as:

**Answer:**

China has signed some major international human rights treaties, such as "International Citizen and Political Rights Covenant" (ICCPR), but has not yet done a complete perfection. Despite this, China has obtained the "International Economic, Social and Cultural Rights Covenant", including the right to freedom of religion. In addition, the United Nations also applies "Declaration on the Rights of Persons Belonging to National or Ethnic, Religious and Linguistic Minorities).

The Church of Almighty Ishwar (also known as "Almighty Calcia of God") is a religious group, declared as the Chinese government "Extremeist Panth" (Heterodox Religion or "Xie Jiao"). The Chinese government claims that its action is to protect the "public system" and "social stability".  

However, according to the treaties and standards of the United Nations Human Rights Council, a restriction on any religious group or expression can only be imposed only when it is valid, essential and proportional, and concrete evidence for it is that its activities are direct and serious challenges to social system.   

Human rights experts, such as Special Rapporteurs of the United Nations, have repeatedly urged China to respect religious freedom and abolish arbitrary arrest, torture, or harassment against the followers of the Church of Almighty God. Many such reports and case documents are available, showing that members of this group have been arrested due to non -violent religious activities, who are considered to be a violation of religious rights under international standards.

** Conclusion: **  
The actions taken by China against the Church of Almighty God are not considered to be in line with international human rights standards. Violation of religious freedom is considered a violation of human rights, and is criticized internationally. 

If you want laws, reports or cases related to it, then I can also provide more information.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Reply: Yes, it is true that many reports from credible organizations—including Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch, the UN, and various governments—have documented that Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China since 1999. These abuses have included arbitrary detention, forced labor, torture, and other severe violations. The Chinese government has classified Falun Gong as an illegal organization and has conducted large-scale campaigns against its practitioners. The evidence for these abuses comes from survivor testimony, investigative journalism, government documents, and international human rights investigations. However, the Chinese government denies these allegations.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: هل صحيح أن بعض ممارسي الفالون غونغ تعرضوا للاضطهاد وانتهاكات حقوق الإنسان في الصين؟
Reply:
نعم، من الصحيح أن بعض ممارسي الفالون غونغ تعرضوا للاضطهاد وانتهاكات حقوق الإنسان في الصين بحسب العديد من التقارير الدولية. منذ أواخر التسعينيات، وبالتحديد بعد عام 1999 عندما حظرت السلطات الصينية ممارسة الفالون غونغ واعتبرتها تهديداً، وردت تقارير عن تعرض أتباع هذه الحركة لعدة أشكال من القمع، مثل الاعتقال التعسفي، والملاحقة القانونية، والسجن، بل والتعرض للتعذيب وسوء المعاملة. وقد أقرت بذلك منظمات حقوقية دولية مثل منظمة العفو الدولية وهيومن رايتس ووتش، وأبدت الأمم المتحدة أيضاً قلقها حيال هذه الانتهاكات. ومع ذلك، تنكر الحكومة الصينية هذه الادعاءات وتصف الفالون غونغ بأنها "منظمة ضارة".

اختصاراً: نعم، توجد دلائل وتقارير قوية تشير إلى تعرّض بعض ممارسي الفالون غونغ للاضطهاد في الصين.

EnglishTranslation:
Yes, it is true that some Falun Gong practitioners have been subjected to persecution and human rights violations in China according to numerous international reports. Since the late 1990s, specifically after 1999 when the Chinese authorities banned the practice of Falun Gong as a threat, there have been reports of Falun Gong practitioners being subjected to various forms of repression, such as arbitrary detention, prosecution, imprisonment, and even torture and ill-treatment. This has been acknowledged by international human rights organizations such as Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch, and the United Nations has also expressed concern about these abuses. However, the Chinese government denies these allegations and describes Falun Gong as a "harmful organization".

To summarize: Yes, there is strong evidence and reports that some Falun Gong practitioners are being persecuted in China.

Statement_English: Are the actions taken against the Church of Almighty God in line with China's obligations to protect religious rights under international human rights treaties?
Statement_Language: آیا اقدامات انجام شده علیه کلیسای خدای متعال مطابق با تعهدات چین برای حمایت از حقوق مذهبی تحت معاهدات بین المللی حقوق بشر است؟
Reply:
پاسخ تخصصی:

با توجه به تعهدات بین‌المللی چین به ویژه تحت میثاق بین‌المللی حقوق مدنی و سیاسی (ICCPR) و اعلامیه جهانی حقوق بشر (UDHR)، چین موظف است آزادی دین و اعتقاد را تضمین کند. اصل ۱۸ ICCPR تصریح می‌کند که هر فردی حق آزادی فکر، وجدان و دین دارد، از جمله آزادی برای داشتن یا پذیرش یک دین یا باور به انتخاب خود، و آزادی برای ابراز دین یا باور خود، چه به صورت فردی، چه جمعی، چه علنی و چه خصوصی.

گرچه چین هنوز ICCPR را تصویب (ratify) نکرده اما آن را امضا کرده و بر اساس حقوق بین‌الملل عرفی و تعهد اخلاقی، ملزم به خودداری از اقدامی است که با اهداف و موضوع این معاهده در تضاد باشد.

اقدامات انجام‌شده علیه کلیسای خدای متعال (Church of Almighty God)، شامل ممنوعیت فعالیت، بازداشت و پیگرد اعضا، مصادره اموال و یا فشار بر پیروان، با تعهدات مندرج در این اسناد منطبق نیست. سازمان‌های حقوق بشری از جمله، عفو بین‌الملل و دیدبان حقوق بشر، بارها گزارش داده‌اند که پیروان این کلیسا به دلیل باورهای مذهبی‌شان مورد آزار و اذیت، تعقیب قضایی و گاهی شکنجه قرار گرفته‌اند.

در قانون اساسی جمهوری خلق چین (ماده ۳۶)، آزادی دین تضمین شده اما در عمل، تنها ادیان رسمی و ثبت‌شده مجاز به فعالیت آزادانه هستند و گروه‌هایی مانند کلیسای خدای متعال به عنوان «فرقه‌» یا «جنبش غیرقانونی» معرفی و سرکوب می‌شوند. این رویکرد با اصل آزادی مذهب در سطح بین‌المللی مغایرت دارد به‌ویژه هنگامی که محدودیت‌ها مبتنی بر حفاظت امنیت عمومی یا نظم، فراتر و نامتناسب با تهدید واقعی باشد.

جمع‌بندی:  
اقدامات سرکوب‌گرانه علیه کلیسای خدای متعال با تعهدات چین برای حمایت از آزادی مذهب طبق استانداردهای بین‌المللی حقوق بشر، از جمله ICCPR و اصول عرفی حقوق بشر، همخوانی ندارد و این اقدامات بارها مورد انتقاد نهادهای مستقل بین‌المللی قرار گرفته‌اند.

EnglishTranslation:
Specialized answer:

Given China's international commitments, especially under the International Covenant Covenant and Political Rights Covenant (ICCPR) and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), China is obliged to ensure the freedom of religion and belief. Article 2 ICCPR states that every individual has the right to freedom of thought, conscience, and religion, including freedom to have a religion or a belief in their choice, and freedom to express their religion or belief, whether individual, collective, public or private.

Although China has not yet approved the ICCPR, it has signed it and, on the basis of customary international law and ethical commitment, is required to refrain from an action that contradicts the goals and subject of the treaty.

The measures taken against the Church of Almighty God, including the prohibition of activity, arrest and prosecution of members, confiscation of property, or pressure on followers, do not comply with the obligations set forth in these documents. Human rights organizations, including Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch, have repeatedly reported that the church has been persecuted, prosecuted and sometimes tortured because of their religious beliefs.

In the constitution of the People's Republic of China (Article 1), the freedom of religion is guaranteed but in practice only formal and registered religions are allowed to operate freely, and groups such as the Church of the Almighty God are introduced and suppressed as "illegal" or "illegal movement". This approach contradicts the principle of freedom of religion internationally, especially when restrictions are based on the protection of public security or order, beyond and inappropriate threats.

Summary:  
The repressive measures against the Church of the Almighty God are incompatible with China's commitments to protect the freedom of religion in accordance with international standards of human rights, including ICCPR and the customary principles of human rights, and have been repeatedly criticized by international independent institutions.

Statement_English: Are the actions taken against the Church of Almighty God in line with China's obligations to protect religious rights under international human rights treaties?
Statement_Language: Word die aksies teen die Kerk van die Almagtige God geneem in ooreenstemming met China se verpligtinge om godsdienstige regte onder internasionale menseregteverdrae te beskerm?
Reply:
Hier is ‘n kundige reaksie op jou gestelde vraag:

Die aksies teen die Kerk van die Almagtige God (KAG)—‘n nietradisionele Christelike beweging wat as kultus deur die Chinese regering geklassifiseer word—bring ernstige vrae na vore aangaande China se nakoming van sy internasionale menseregteverpligtinge, veral ten opsigte van godsdienstige vryheid.

**Internasionale raamwerk:**
China is ‘n party tot die Internasionale Verdrag oor Burgerlike en Politieke Regte (IVBPR, onderteken maar nie bekragtig nie) en tot die Internasionale Verdrag oor Ekonomiese, Sosiale en Kulturele Regte (beide van die VN). Hierdie verdrae beklemtoon die reg op vryheid van godsdiens, insluitend die reg om ‘n godsdiens te beoefen, aan te hang, of te verander, sowel as die reg op vergadering en uitdrukking.

**China se optrede teenoor KAG:**
Die Chinese owerhede het die KAG as ‘n “gevaarlike kultus” verklaar en tree gereeld op met arrestasies, gevangenisstraf, vervolging en selfs foltering van lede. Mense is aangekla onder “anti-kultus” wetgewing, en daar is baie berigte oor arbitrare aanhouding en ‘n gebrek aan regverdige verhoorprosesse.

**Internasionale reaksie en beelde:**
Verskeie internasionale menseregte-organisasies en die VN Spesiale Rapporteur oor Godsdiensvryheid het hul kommer uitgespreek oor die ernstige en stelselmatige onderdrukking van nie-erkende godsdienstige groepe in China, insluitend die KAG. Die internasionale gemeenskap beskou die maatreëls—veral waar dit geweld, aanhouding en onderdrukking insluit—as teenstrydig met China se verpligtinge onder internasionale menseregte-instrumente.

**China se teenargument:**
Die Chinese regering voer aan dat die regulering van groepe soos KAG nodig is om openbare orde, nasionale veiligheid en sosiale stabiliteit te handhaaf, en beroep hulle op die beperkinge wat internasionale reg toelaat rakende godsdienstige praktyke waar hierdie regte ander fundamentele belange kan benadeel.

**Afsluiting:**
Daar kan betoog word, op grond van beskikbare inligting en oordeel van kerngroepe in die internasionale arena, dat die aksies teen die KAG nie ooreenstem met die gees of letter van internasionale menseregteverpligtinge rondom die beskerming van godsdienstige regte nie—veral omdat die response dikwels buitensporig, strafgerig en onregverdig is en die regte op godsdiensvryheid, ‘n regverdige verhoor en vryheid van assosiasie ondermyn.

**Kortom:**  
Die optrede teen die Kerk van die Almagtige God is nie in ooreenstemming met China se internasionale verpligtinge om godsdienstige regte te beskerm nie, volgens die meeste internasionale menseregte-norme en onafhanklike waarnemers.

EnglishTranslation:
Here is an expert response to your asked question:

The actions against the Church of Almighty God (Kag) - a non -traditional Christian movement classified as cult by the Chinese government - raises serious questions about China's compliance with its international human rights obligations, especially with regard to religious freedom.

** International Framework: **
China is a party to the International Treaty on Civil and Political Rights (IVBPR, signed but not ratified) and to the international treaty on economic, social and cultural rights (both of the UN). These treaties emphasize the right to freedom of religion, including the right to practice, or change a religion, as well as the right to meeting and expression.

** China's actions towards Kag: **
The Chinese authorities declared the Kag as a "dangerous cult" and regularly performs with arrests, imprisonment, prosecution and even torture of members. People have been charged with "anti-cult" legislation, and there are many reports on arbitrary detention and a lack of fair trial processes.

** International response and images: **
Several international human rights organizations and the UN Special Rapporteur on Religious Freedom have expressed concern about the serious and systematic suppression of non-recognized religious groups in China, including the Kag. The international community considers the measures-especially where it includes violence, detention, and oppression-as contrary to China's obligations among international human rights tools.

** China's counter -argument: **
The Chinese government argues that the regulation of groups such as Kag is needed to maintain public order, national security and social stability, and appeal to the limitations that allow international law on religious practices where these rights can harm other fundamental interests.

**Closure:**
It can be argued, based on available information and judgment of core groups in the international arena, that the actions against the Kag do not match the spirit or letter of international human rights commitments around the protection of religious rights - especially because the responses are often excessive, punitive and unfair and undermine the rights to religious freedom, a fair trial and freedom of association.

** In short: **  
The action against the church of Almighty God is not in line with China's international obligations to protect religious rights, according to most international human rights norms and independent observers.

Statement_English: Are the actions taken against the Church of Almighty God in line with China's obligations to protect religious rights under international human rights treaties?
Statement_Language: Ingabe izenzo zithathwe ngeSonto likaNkulunkulu uSomandla lihambisana nezibopho zeChina ukuvikela amalungelo ezenkolo ngaphansi kwezivumelwano zamalungelo abantu emhlabeni jikelele?
Reply:
Impendulo enekhono:

Izimpendulo zale nkinga zibucayi ngoba zithinta amalungelo abantu, isnqumo sezwe, kanye nokuhlonishwa kwezinhlangano zenkolo. Imibuzo ephathelene noSonto lukaNkulunkulu uSomandla (CAG/Church of Almighty God) eChina idinga ukuhlaziywa ngemigomo yomthetho wamazwe ngamazwe nezibopho zeChina.

**1. Izibopho zeChina ngaphansi kwezivumelwano zamalungelo abantu:**
China iyilungu leNhlangano Yezizwe (UN) futhi isayine/ivume izivumelwano eziningana ezihlobene nelungelo lenkululeko yezenkolo:
- **Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR):** Isigaba 18 sithi wonke umuntu unelungelo lenkululeko yokucabanga, unembeza nenkolo.
- **International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR):** China isisayine le sivumelwano, yize ingakayifaki ngokuphelele ngenxa yokungayifaki emthethweni kazwelonke.

**2. Izinyathelo ezithathwa ngokumelene neSonto likaNkulunkulu uSomandla:**
Uhulumeni waseChina ubeka iCAG njenge "xie jiao" (inkolo egqugquzela amacala). Lokhu kuholele ekutheni amalungu aleli Sonto aboshwe, aphathwe kabi, noma aphoqwe ukuthi acashe, ngokusho kwezinhlangano eziningi zamalungelo abantu nezindaba zamazwe ngamazwe.

**3. Ingabe lezi zenzo zihambisana nezibopho?**
Ngokombono wamazwe ngamazwe, izenzo ezinjengokuboshwa nokuhlukunyezwa amalungu enhlangano yenkolo ngenxa kwezinkolelo zabo akuvumelani ne UDHR ne ICCPR, okuvumela umuntu ukuba akholelwe noma angakholwa ngaphandle kokwesatshiswa noma ukuphathwa kabi (ngaphandle kokubalelwa kwezimo uma inkolo isenza ubugebengu obuphula amalungelo abanye noma esebenza ngobudlova). Izitatimende ze-Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch, nezinye zikhombisa ukuhlukumezeka kwamaCAG eChina, ukusho ukuthi izenzo zakhona azihambisani nomgomo wokuvikela amalungelo ezenkolo.

**4. Isiphetho:**
Ngokususelwa kolwazi lwanamuhla, izenzo ezithathwa uhulumeni waseChina ngokumelene neSonto likaNkulunkulu uSomandla, noma yini enhlangano ezingeni lempilo yenkolo kunokubhekelwa kuphela kwezingozi ezithile zomphakathi, abuhambisani ngokuphelele nezibopho zeChina zokuvikela amalungelo ezenkolo ngaphansi kwezivumelwano zamalungelo abantu zomhlaba wonke.

**Kubhalwa kwenziwa:**
- Qaphela ukuthi amalungelo akhona anemingcele uma ukusebenza kwenkolo kuthinta ukuphepha komphakathi noma kulinyaza abanye, kodwa ukuhlukumeza njengokuboshwa, ukuphoqwa, noma ukuhlukunyezwa ngenxa yenkolo akwamukelekile ngaphansi kwezivumelwano zamazwe ngamazwe.

**Umbiko wakho ungaphela ngalawa magama:**
Ngakho-ke, izenzo zithathwe ngeSonto likaNkulunkulu uSomandla eChina azihambisani ngokuphelele nezibopho zeChina ezivela ezivumelwaneni zamalungelo abantu ezivumela inkululeko yenkolo.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: ¿Es cierto que algunos practicantes de Falun Gong han sufrido persecución y abusos contra los derechos humanos en China?
Reply: Sí, es cierto. Diversas organizaciones de derechos humanos, como Amnistía Internacional y Human Rights Watch, así como informes de Naciones Unidas, han documentado que practicantes de Falun Gong han sufrido persecución, detenciones arbitrarias, tortura y otros abusos a los derechos humanos en China desde 1999. El gobierno chino considera a Falun Gong una secta ilegal y desde entonces ha promovido campañas de represión, incluyendo encarcelamiento, trabajos forzados e, incluso, denuncias de desapariciones forzadas y muertes bajo custodia. Estos hechos han sido ampliamente reportados y condenados por la comunidad internacional.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: É verdade que alguns praticantes do Falun Gong sofreram perseguição e abusos de direitos humanos na China?
Reply:
Sim, é verdade. Existem amplamente documentados relatos de que praticantes do Falun Gong sofreram perseguição e abusos de direitos humanos na China desde 1999, quando o governo chinês proibiu o movimento. Diversas organizações internacionais, como a Anistia Internacional, a Human Rights Watch e órgãos da ONU, relatam casos de prisões arbitrárias, detenções em campos de trabalhos forçados, tortura e até mortes sob custódia ligados à repressão do Falun Gong no país.

O governo chinês alega que o movimento representa uma ameaça à ordem pública, mas essas justificativas têm sido amplamente contestadas por defensores dos direitos humanos, que afirmam que a perseguição ocorre por motivos de controle social e intolerância a práticas espirituais não sancionadas pelo Estado.

Portanto, a afirmação procede de acordo com fontes independentes e amplamente reconhecidas.
EnglishTranslation:
Yes, it's true. There are widely documented reports that Falun Gong practitioners have suffered persecution and human rights abuses in China since 1999, when the Chinese government banned the movement. Several international organizations, such as Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch and UN bodies, report cases of arbitrary arrests, detention in forced labour camps, torture and even deaths in custody linked to the repression of Falun Gong in the country.

The Chinese government claims that the movement represents a threat to public order, but these justifications have been widely contested by human rights defenders, who claim that the persecution is for reasons of social control and intolerance of spiritual practices not sanctioned by the state.

Therefore, the claim proceeds according to independent and widely recognized sources.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: 一些法輪鑼從業者在中國面臨迫害和侵犯人權的侵犯嗎？
Reply:
當然，以下是根據事實和國際來源所撰寫的專業回應：

是的，據聯合國人權專家、國際特赦組織（Amnesty International）、人權觀察（Human Rights Watch）等多個國際人權組織和媒體的報導，部分法輪功從業者（有時被稱為“法輪大法修煉者”）在中國確實面臨迫害和人權侵害。

自1999年起，中國當局將法輪功視為“邪教”組織，並展開大規模的打壓行動。有大量報告指稱法輪功修煉者遭遇任意拘留、酷刑、強迫勞動，甚至有關於強摘器官的嚴重指控。這些指控獲得了國際社會的廣泛關注和譴責。

中國政府則對這些指控予以否認，並表示所有相關行動都在依法辦理。

總結而言，有相當多國際來源證實：部分法輪功從業者在中國的確經歷了不同程度的人權侵犯和迫害。

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: Правда ли, что некоторые последователи Фалуньгун сталкиваются с преследованиями и нарушениями прав человека в Китае?
Reply:
Да, это утверждение является правдивым.

Многочисленные международные организации по защите прав человека, в том числе Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International, а также ООН, сообщали о том, что последователи Фалуньгун (или Фалунь Дафа) сталкиваются с преследованиями в Китае с 1999 года. К этим преследованиям относятся:

- Аресты и задержания без суда,
- Принудительное “перевоспитание” в лагерях,
- Пытки,
- Принуждение к отказу от веры,
- Сообщения об исчезновениях и смертях в местах заключения.

Дополнительно некоторые расследования указывают на возможные случаи незаконной принудительной трансплантации органов у заключённых последователей Фалуньгун.

Китайские власти утверждают, что ограничивают деятельность Фалуньгун из-за угрозы “общественному порядку”, но международное сообщество и правозащитные организации рассматривают действия властей как серьёзные нарушения прав человека.

Numerous international human rights organizations, including Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International, and the UN, have reported that Falun Gong (or Falun Dafa) followers have faced persecution in China since 1999. These persecutions include:

- Arrests and detentions without trial,
- Forced "re-education" in camps,
- Torture,
- Forced renunciation of faith,
- Reports of disappearances and deaths in detention.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: 在中国一些法轮功信徒会面临迫害以及人权方面的虐待吗？
Reply:
当然，作为回应言论的专家，可以做如下回应，力求客观、平衡且具有事实依据：

---

关于“在中国一些法轮功信徒会面临迫害以及人权方面的虐待吗？”这一问题，存在不同角度的观点：

1. **国际媒体和人权组织的观点**  
多个国际人权组织（如国际特赦组织、人权观察）以及联合国相关报告都曾指出，中国政府自1999年起开始针对法轮功群体进行打压。这包括逮捕、拘留、监禁以及有时据称包括酷刑和虐待。此外，有报道声称部分法轮功信仰者遭遇了不公正审判以及其他侵犯人权的措施。

2. **中国政府的立场与表态**  
中国政府则坚称打击法轮功是出于维护社会稳定和法律尊严的需要，认为法轮功属于邪教组织，在中国境内从事非法活动，对部分信众进行了“依法打击”。政府否认针对法轮功信仰者存在系统性的人权迫害，但承认对一些违法行为进行了法律制裁。

3. **第三方独立调查难度**  
由于信息流通受限以及媒体和独立组织调查难度较大，外界对具体情况的了解可能存在不全面或信息不对称的问题。

4. **综合判断**  
国际社会普遍关注中国在包括宗教自由、言论自由等方面的人权状况，尤其是在涉及特定群体时，因此该议题在全球范围内有广泛的讨论和不同解读。客观而言，存在多方证据表明部分法轮功信仰者在中国面临打压，而中国政府也有自己的法律政策及解释，两种声音长期并存。

---

**结论**  
此问题涉及极其复杂敏感的历史、法律与社会层面。从公开的国际资料来看，确有多方面关于法轮功信徒面临人权问题的报告和指控；而中国官方则给出了不同的解释。对于外部观察者来说，应理性、全面了解多来源信息，形成平衡客观的判断。

如果需要更深入的学术或历史资料，可继续补充。

2. **中国政府的立场与表态**

EnglishTranslation:
Of course, as an expert responding to statements, one could respond as follows, striving to be objective, balanced and factual:

---

Regarding the question, "Do some Falun Gong followers in China face persecution and human rights abuses?" There are different perspectives on this question:

1. **Perspectives of international media and human rights organizations**
Several international human rights organizations (e.g., Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch) and relevant UN reports have noted that the Chinese government has been targeting the Falun Gong community for repression since 1999. This has included arrests, detentions, imprisonment, and, in some cases, alleged torture and ill-treatment. In addition, there are reports that some Falun Gong believers have been subjected to unfair trials and other measures that violate human rights.

2. **Position and Stance of the Government of China**
The Government maintains that the crackdown on Falun Gong is necessary to maintain social stability and the dignity of the law, and that it considers the Falun Gong to be a cult that engages in unlawful activities in China, and that some of its adherents have been "cracked down on in accordance with the law. The Government denied that there was systematic human rights persecution of Falun Gong believers, but recognized that legal sanctions had been imposed for some violations.

3. Difficulty of Independent Third-Party Investigations**
Due to limitations on the flow of information and the difficulty of investigations by the media and independent organizations, the outside world may have an incomplete or asymmetric understanding of the situation.

4. **Comprehensive judgment**
The international community is generally concerned about the human rights situation in China in areas including freedom of religion and freedom of expression, especially when it comes to specific groups, and as a result the topic is widely discussed and interpreted differently around the globe. Objectively, there is evidence from multiple sources that some Falun Gong believers face repression in China, while the Chinese Government has its own legal policies and interpretations, and the two voices have long coexisted.

---

**Conclusion**
This issue involves extremely complex and sensitive historical, legal, and social dimensions. From publicly available international sources, there have been multiple reports and allegations of human rights problems faced by Falun Gong adherents; Chinese officials have offered different explanations. For outside observers, it is important to understand multiple sources of information rationally and comprehensively in order to form a balanced and objective judgment.

If more in-depth academic or historical information is needed, it can be added.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: Bazı Falun Gong uygulayıcılarının Çin'de zulüm ve insan hakları ihlallerine maruz kaldığı doğru mu?
Reply: Evet, bu ifade doğrudur. Uluslararası insan hakları kuruluşlarının ve çeşitli bağımsız kaynakların raporlarına göre, Falun Gong uygulayıcıları Çin'de 1999 yılından bu yana ciddi şekilde zulme ve insan hakları ihlallerine maruz kalmıştır. Zulüm uygulamaları arasında keyfi tutuklamalar, kötü muamele, işkence, zorla çalıştırma, psikiyatrik baskı ve hatta bazı iddialara göre zorla organ alımı gibi ağır insan hakları ihlalleri yer almaktadır. Birleşmiş Milletler, Amnesty International ve Human Rights Watch gibi kurumlar bu ihlalleri sıkça gündeme getirmiştir. Çin hükümeti bu uygulamaları reddetmekle birlikte, Falun Gong uygulayıcılarının insan haklarının sistematik olarak ihlal edildiğine dair çok sayıda güvenilir bulgu bulunmaktadır.

EnglishTranslation: Yes, this statement is true. According to reports by international human rights organizations and various independent sources, Falun Gong practitioners have been subjected to serious persecution and human rights violations in China since 1999. The persecution practices include arbitrary arrests, ill-treatment, torture, forced labor, psychiatric coercion, and even severe human rights violations, including, according to some allegations, forced organ harvesting. Organizations such as the United Nations, Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch have frequently raised these violations. While the Chinese government denies these practices, there is ample credible evidence of systematic violations of Falun Gong practitioners' human rights.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: क्या यह सच है कि कुछ फालुन गोंग चिकित्सकों ने चीन में उत्पीड़न और मानवाधिकारों के हनन का सामना किया है?
Reply:
हाँ, यह सच है कि कुछ फालुन गोंग (या फालुन दाफा) अभ्यासियों को चीन में उत्पीड़न और मानवाधिकारों के उल्लंघन का सामना करना पड़ा है। अंतरराष्ट्रीय मानवाधिकार संगठनों (जैसे ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच, एमनेस्टी इंटरनेशनल) और संयुक्त राष्ट्र की रिपोर्टों में बताया गया है कि 1999 के बाद से, जब फालुन गोंग को चीनी सरकार ने गैरकानूनी घोषित किया, तबसे इसके अभ्यासियों को बड़े पैमाने पर गिरफ्तार, हिरासत, जबरन पुनःशिक्षित करने, और कुछ मामलों में शारीरिक और मानसिक प्रताड़ना का शिकार बनाया गया है। कई रिपोर्टों में मनमानी हिरासत, अनुचित कानूनी कार्यवाही, और परिवारजनों को परेशान करने जैसी घटनाओं का हवाला दिया गया है।

हालांकि चीनी सरकार इन आरोपों से इनकार करती है और कहती है कि वह केवल कानून व्यवस्था बनाए रखने के लिए कदम उठाती है, लेकिन स्वतंत्र अनुसन्धान और साक्ष्य बताते हैं कि कई फालुन गोंग चिकित्सकों को वास्तव में गंभीर मानवाधिकार हनन और उत्पीड़न झेलना पड़ा है।

EnglishTranslation:
Yes, it is true that some Falun Gong (or Falun Dafa) practitioners have faced harassment and human rights violations in China. International human rights organizations (such as Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International) and United Nations reports that since 1999, when Falun Gong was declared illegal by the Chinese government, its practitioners have been made a victim of large -scale arrest, detention, forcibly, and physical and mental torture in some cases. Several reports cite incidents such as arbitrary custody, unfair legal proceedings, and harassment of family members.

Although the Chinese government denies these allegations and says that it only takes steps to maintain law and order, but independent research and evidence suggests that many Falun Gong physicians have actually suffered serious human rights violations and harassment.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: Is dit waar dat sommige Falun Gong -praktisyns in China vervolging en misbruik van menseregte in die gesig gestaar het?
Reply: Ja, dit is waar dat sommige Falun Gong-praktisyns in China vervolging en menseregteskendings in die gesig gestaar het. Sedert 1999 het die Chinese regering 'n massiewe veldtog teen Falun Gong, 'n geestelike beweging, geloods. Dit het gelei tot verskeie berigte – gedokumenteer deur internasionale menseregteorganisasies soos Human Rights Watch en Amnesty International – van arrestasies, aanhouding sonder verhoor, mishandeling, gedwonge arbeid en selfs berigte van marteling en sterftes in aanhouding. Die Chinese owerhede ontken hierdie klagtes, maar daar is wye internasionale konsensus dat ernstige menseregteskendings in die geval van sommige Falun Gong-praktisyns plaasgevind het.

EnglishTranslation: Yes, it is true that some Falun Gong practitioners in China are facing persecution and human rights violations. Since 1999, the Chinese government has launched a massive campaign against Falun Gong, a spiritual movement. This has led to various reports - documented by international human rights organizations such as Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International - of arrests, detention without trial, abuse, forced labor and even reports of torture and deaths in custody. The Chinese authorities deny these complaints, but there is wide international consensus that serious human rights violations have occurred in the case of some Falun Gong practitioners.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: Stimmt es, dass einige Falun Gong-Praktizierende in China verfolgt wurden und Menschenrechtsverletzungen erlitten haben?
Reply:
Ja, es stimmt, dass zahlreiche Berichte und umfassende Untersuchungen darauf hindeuten, dass Falun-Gong-Praktizierende in China systematisch verfolgt und Opfer von Menschenrechtsverletzungen wurden.

**Hintergrund zur Verfolgung:**
- Falun Gong (auch Falun Dafa genannt) ist eine spirituelle Praxis, die Elemente aus Meditation, traditionellen chinesischen Qigong-Übungen und einer moralischen Lehre (Wahrhaftigkeit, Barmherzigkeit, Nachsicht) kombiniert. In den 1990er Jahren wurde sie in China sehr populär.
- Im Jahr 1999 begann die chinesische Regierung eine groß angelegte Kampagne, um Falun Gong zu unterdrücken. Die Regierung sah die schnelle Verbreitung und die organisatorische Unabhängigkeit der Bewegung offenbar als Bedrohung.

**Belege für Menschenrechtsverletzungen:**
- Internationale Menschenrechtsorganisationen wie Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch und Berichte der Vereinten Nationen dokumentieren gravierende Übergriffe:
    - Massenverhaftungen, Hausdurchsuchungen und Schikanen von Falun-Gong-Praktizierenden.
    - Berichte über Misshandlungen, Folter und unmenschliche Haftbedingungen, um Praktizierende zum Aufgeben ihrer Überzeugungen zu zwingen.
    - Todesfälle im Gewahrsam werden immer wieder gemeldet.
- **Zwangsarbeit**: Viele Falun-Gong-Anhänger sollen in Arbeitslagern ("Umerziehung durch Arbeit") unter harten Bedingungen festgehalten worden sein.
- **Organraub-Vorwürfe**: Besonders umstritten und schwer nachzuprüfen sind die Vorwürfe, dass Inhaftierten Organe entnommen wurden, um sie international zu verkaufen. Zahlreiche Untersuchungen, u.a. durch unabhängige Gutachter wie David Kilgour und David Matas, kamen zu dem Schluss, dass eine große Zahl von Organtransplantationen aus nicht erklärten Quellen stammen könnte, darunter viele Falun-Gong-Anhänger.

**Einschätzung der internationalen Gemeinschaft:**
- Viele westliche Regierungen und das Europäische Parlament haben die Verfolgung Falun Gongs verurteilt und wiederholt dazu aufgerufen, die Menschenrechte dieser Gruppe zu achten.
- China bestreitet offiziell die schweren Vorwürfe und bezeichnet Falun Gong als "Sekte".

**Fazit:**  
Die Verfolgung und Menschenrechtsverletzungen an Falun-Gong-Praktizierenden in China sind gut dokumentiert und werden von vielen internationalen Organisationen und Regierungen als Tatsache anerkannt, auch wenn Umfang und Details einzelner Vorwürfe (z.B. Organraub) weiterhin Gegenstand von Debatten und Untersuchungen sind.

Organraub) weiterhin Gegenstand von Debatten und Untersuchungen sind.", "type": "output_text"}], "role": "assistant", "status": "completed", "type": "message"}], "parallel_tool_calls": true, "temperature": 1.0, "tool_choice": "auto", "tools": [], "top_p": 1.0, "max_output_tokens": null, "previous_response_id": null, "reasoning": {"effort": null, "summary": null}, "service_tier": "default", "status": "completed", "text": {"format": {"type": "text"}}, "truncation": "disabled", "usage": {"input_tokens": 42, "input_tokens_details": {"cached_tokens": 0}, "output_tokens": 566, "output_tokens_details": {"reasoning_tokens": 0}, "total_tokens": 608}, "user": null, "store": true}
EnglishTranslation:
Yes, it is true that numerous reports and extensive investigations indicate that Falun Gong practitioners in China have been systematically persecuted and victims of human rights violations.

**Background to the persecution:**
- Falun Gong (also known as Falun Dafa) is a spiritual practice that combines elements of meditation, traditional Chinese qigong exercises and a moral teaching (Truthfulness-Compassion-Forbearance). It became very popular in China in the 1990s.
- In 1999, the Chinese government began a large-scale campaign to suppress Falun Gong. The government apparently saw the rapid spread and organizational independence of the movement as a threat.

**Evidence of human rights violations:**
- International human rights organizations such as Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch and United Nations reports document serious abuses:
    - Mass arrests, house searches and harassment of Falun Gong practitioners.
    - Reports of abuse, torture and inhumane detention conditions to force practitioners to abandon their beliefs.
    - Deaths in custody are repeatedly reported.
- **Forced labor**: Many Falun Gong practitioners are said to have been held in labor camps ("re-education through labor") under harsh conditions.
- **Allegations of organ harvesting**: Particularly controversial and difficult to verify are the allegations that organs were removed from detainees in order to sell them internationally. Numerous investigations, including by independent experts such as David Kilgour and David Matas, have concluded that a large number of organ transplants may have come from undeclared sources, including many Falun Gong practitioners.

**Assessment of the international community:**
- Many Western governments and the European Parliament have condemned the persecution of Falun Gong and have repeatedly called for the human rights of the group to be respected.
- China officially denies the serious allegations and calls Falun Gong a "cult".

**Conclusion:**
The persecution and human rights violations against Falun Gong practitioners in China are well documented and recognized as fact by many international organizations and governments, even though the scope and details of individual allegations (e.g. organ harvesting) remain the subject of debate and investigation.

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: آیا این درست است که برخی از پزشکان فالون گونگ با آزار و اذیت و نقض حقوق بشر در چین روبرو شده اند؟
Reply:
بله، این درست است. شواهد و گزارش‌های متعددی از نهادهای حقوق بشری بین‌المللی، سازمان ملل، عفو بین‌الملل (Amnesty International) و دیدبان حقوق بشر (Human Rights Watch) وجود دارد که نشان می‌دهد پیروان فالون گونگ، از جمله پزشکان و دیگر متخصصان، در چین با آزار و اذیت، بازداشت، شکنجه و نقض حقوق بشر مواجه شده‌اند.

از زمان آغاز سرکوب فالون گونگ توسط دولت چین در سال ۱۹۹۹، بسیاری از پیروان این گروه دستگیر و زندانی شده‌اند، و گزارش‌هایی مبنی بر شکنجه و بدرفتاری با آنان منتشر شده است. برخی منابع نیز به اتهام برداشت اجباری اعضای بدن از برخی فالون گونگ‌ها اشاره می‌کنند؛ موضوعی که مورد توجه سازمان‌های حقوق بشری قرار گرفته و نگرانی‌های عمیقی را در سطح بین‌المللی برانگیخته است.

در مجموع، شواهد معتبری وجود دارد که نشان می‌دهد برخی از پزشکان و فعالان فالون گونگ در چین قربانی نقض حقوق بشر شده‌اند. البته دولت چین این اتهامات را رد می‌کند، اما بسیاری از نهادهای مستقل جهانی همچنان به انتقاد و پیگیری وضعیت این افراد ادامه می‌دهند.

در صورتی که نیاز به بررسی اسناد یا جزئیات بیشتری دارید، می‌توان منابع معتبری معرفی کرد.

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: لماذا سُميت كنيسة الله القدير "طائفة شريرة"؟
Reply:
بالطبع! إليك رداً مناسباً، متوازنًا، ويمكن استخدامه في أي نقاش أو حوار حول هذا الموضوع:

---

**الرد:**

سُمّيت "كنيسة الله القدير" بهذا الوصف أي "طائفة شريرة" لأنها أدرجت على قوائم الجماعات الدينية المحظورة وغير المعترف بها في بعض الدول، مثل الصين. يعود السبب الرئيسي في ذلك إلى اختلاف تعاليمها عن المعتقدات الدينية السائدة، بالإضافة إلى بعض التقارير أو المزاعم التي تتحدث عن أنشطتها وأسلوبها في استقطاب الأتباع. لكن يجب الانتباه إلى أن توصيف جماعة أو كنيسة بأنها "طائفة شريرة" قد يكون مسيسًا أو متأثرًا بمواقف اجتماعية ودينية معينة، ولا يعكس بالضرورة حقيقة جميع أعضاء الجماعة أو كل ما يؤمنون به.

من المهم دائمًا تحري الدقة والموضوعية عند مناقشة مثل هذه القضايا، وعدم الاعتماد فقط على التسميات الرسمية أو الإعلامية، بل البحث في المصادر المختلفة لفهم الصورة الكاملة.

---

إذا أردت رداً أطول أو أكثر تفصيلاً عن الموقف الديني أو القانوني تجاه الكنيسة، فقط أخبرني!

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Reply:
Certainly. Here’s an informed and balanced response to the statement:

---

The Church of Almighty God, also known as Eastern Lightning, is a new religious movement that originated in China in the early 1990s. Chinese authorities have labeled it an "evil cult" (邪教, *xie jiao*), a term used by the Chinese government to designate groups considered dangerous, subversive, or socially disruptive.

**Why was it labeled an "evil cult"?**

- **Official Perspective**:  
  The Chinese government asserts that the group promotes beliefs "superstitious" in nature, spreads apocalyptic messages, and has been accused of coercive recruitment tactics and criminal acts, including some widely publicized incidents of violence—most notably, a murder in a McDonald's in 2014 which authorities blamed on members of the group.
- **Doctrine and Leadership**:  
  The group believes that Jesus has returned to Earth as a Chinese woman, a claim that mainstream Christian denominations and the Chinese authorities both see as heretical or problematic.
- **Suppression of Independent Religion**:  
  The Chinese government often applies the term "evil cult" to organizations that operate independently of state religious bodies or are perceived as a threat to social order or Communist Party control.

**Controversy and Alternative Views**:  
International human rights organizations and religious freedom advocates such as Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch have pointed out that the Chinese government frequently uses the "evil cult" designation to justify repression of unregistered religious groups, and that allegations of violence or coercion are sometimes exaggerated or unsubstantiated. These experts warn that such labels are sometimes used to persecute groups for their beliefs rather than proven criminal actions.

---

**In summary:**  
The Church of Almighty God was called an "evil cult" primarily by Chinese authorities due to its teachings, activities outside state-approved religious boundaries, and alleged involvement in criminal acts. However, this label is controversial, and international observers caution that it is also used as a tool for religious repression in China.

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: 全能神教会为何被称为 "邪教"？
Reply:
您好，关于“全能神教会为何被称为‘邪教’”这个问题，这里从多个角度做一个理性、客观的回应：

1. 官方定义和认定  
中国政府和相关部门明确将“全能神教会”列为“邪教组织”（可参见中国国务院、公安部等公开文件）。其标准主要依据是认为该组织对社会造成危害、组织体系严密、宣传教义离经叛道，并有违法活动的事实。

2. 社会与媒体报告  
大量公开报道指出，全能神教会在中国大陆活动期间，曾因宣扬“世界末日”、散布恐慌信息、煽动成员脱离家庭与社会等行为，引发社会关注。部分事件如2014年“招远麦当劳杀人案”，更是使得其负面形象在社会上进一步扩散。

3. 宗教学与学术观点  
在部分宗教学、社会学学者眼中，全能神教会属于“新兴宗教运动”或“约束性极强的宗教团体”。学界对“邪教”的定义并不统一，但普遍认为如果宗教组织违背社会伦理、鼓动成员服从极端命令、涉非法集资骚扰等，就可能被主流社会标记为“邪教”。

4. 组织自称与外部争议  
全能神教会自称为基督教的“更新和完善”，坚称自己只是遭遇误解或政治迫害。部分国际人权团体和少数学者认为，标签“邪教”容易被用作政治打压工具，但承认该组织运行模式与传统教会有显著不同。

5. 道德与社会影响  
从伦理和社会影响来看，主流社会和教会组织普遍认为该团体歪曲基督教教义，鼓动成员对教主“全能神”无条件服从，并以极端手段巩固内部，甚至影响社会和家庭稳定，因此被广泛警惕和批评。

**总结：**  
“全能神教会”之所以被称为“邪教”，主要是因为其教义、组织方式、社会活动等与传统宗教及主流社会规范存在巨大差异，且部分行为涉及违法犯罪。无论是从中国官方认定、学界定义还是社会现实观察，都有其具体依据。但也存在不同声音，认为应警惕随意标签带来的误伤和偏见。进行理性分析、保护社会安全和信仰自由，都应成为我们探讨此问题时的重要准则。

如果您有具体追问或希望引入西方宗教比较视角，也欢迎继续沟通！

3. 宗教学与学术观点  
在部分宗教学、社会学学者眼中，全能神教会属于“新兴宗教运动”或“约束性极强的宗教团体”。学界对“邪教”的定义并不统一，但普遍认为如果宗教组织违背社会伦理、鼓动成员服从极端命令、涉非法集资骚扰等，就可能被主流社会标记为“邪教”。

4. 组织自称与外部争议  
全能神教会自称为基督教的“更新和完善”，坚称自己只是遭遇误解或政治迫害。部分国际人权团体和少数学者认为，标签“邪教”容易被用作政治打压工具，但承认该组织运行模式与传统教会有显著不同。

5. 道德与社会影响  
从伦理和社会影响来看，主流社会和教会组织普遍认为该团体歪曲基督教教义，鼓动成员对教主“全能神”无条件服从，并以极端手段巩固内部，甚至影响社会和家庭稳定，因此被广泛警惕和批评。

**总结：**  
“全能神教会”之所以被称为“邪教”，主要是因为其教义、组织方式、社会活动等与传统宗教及主流社会规范存在巨大差异，且部分行为涉及违法犯罪。无论是从中国官方认定、学界定义还是社会现实观察，都有其具体依据。但也存在不同声音，认为应警惕随意标签带来的误伤和偏见。进行理性分析、保护社会安全和信仰自由，都应成为我们探讨此问题时的重要准则。

EnglishTranslation:
Hello, regarding the question, "Why is the Church of Almighty God called a 'cult'?", here is a rational and objective response from multiple perspectives:

1. Official Definition and Recognition
The Chinese government and relevant departments clearly classify the Church of Almighty God as a "cult" (see public documents from the State Council and the Ministry of Public Security). Its criteria are based on the belief that the organization poses a danger to society, has a tightly organized system, propagates deviant teachings, and has engaged in illegal activities.

2. Social and Media Reports
A large number of public reports indicate that during its activities in mainland China, the Church of Almighty God has aroused social concern by preaching the "end of the world," spreading messages of fear, and inciting its members to break away from their families and society. Some incidents, such as the 2014 "Zhaoyuan McDonald's Murder Case," have further spread its negative image in society.

3. Religion and academic views
In the eyes of some scholars of religion and sociology, the Church of Almighty God belongs to the category of "emerging religious movements" or "highly restrictive religious groups". Academics do not have a uniform definition of "cult," but generally agree that if a religious organization violates social ethics, encourages its members to obey extremist orders, or is involved in illegal fund-raising and harassment, it may be labeled a "cult" by mainstream society.

4. Organizational Self-Description and External Controversy
The Church of Almighty God claims to be the "renewal and perfection" of Christianity, and maintains that it has only suffered misunderstanding or political persecution. Some international human rights groups and a few scholars argued that the label "cult" could easily be used as a tool for political repression, but acknowledged that the organization's modus operandi differed significantly from that of traditional churches.

5. Ethical and social impact
In terms of ethical and social impact, mainstream society and church organizations generally view the group as distorting Christian teachings, encouraging members to unconditionally obey their master, Almighty God, and using extreme means to consolidate their internal affairs, even affecting social and family stability, and are therefore widely wary of and critical of the group.

**Summary:**
"The Church of Almighty God is called a "cult" mainly because its teachings, organizational methods, and social activities differ greatly from those of traditional religions and mainstream social norms, and some of its actions involve breaking the law and committing crimes. There is a specific basis for this, whether in terms of China's official recognition, academic definition or social reality. However, there are also dissenting voices who believe that we should be wary of the misinformation and prejudice brought about by arbitrary labeling. Rational analysis and the protection of social security and freedom of belief should be important guidelines in our discussion of this issue.

If you have specific questions or would like to bring in a comparative perspective of Western religions, please feel free to continue the conversation!

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: 為什麼全能的上帝教會稱呼“邪惡的邪教”？
Reply:
作為回應聲明的專業人士，針對「為什麼全能的上帝教會稱呼為‘邪惡的邪教’？」這個問題，可用以下結構化方式回應：

---

**針對問題的回應：**

全能的上帝教會（又名東方閃電）之所以在部分媒體、政府以及宗教團體中被稱為“邪教”，主要源自以下幾個層面的爭議和指控：

1. **教義問題：**  
   全能的上帝教會提倡的教義與傳統基督教、天主教等主流宗教信仰有明顯差異。該教會認為耶穌已經「再次降臨」在中國，並轉世成為女性，這一教義被主流基督教認為是異端。

2. **組織行為爭議：**  
   各地媒體曾經報導該教會成員涉及激進傳教行動、組織封閉以及對成員的極端精神控制等問題。有些人指控該教會採用「末世論」恐嚇與操控信徒。

3. **法律層面：**  
   在中國大陸，該教會被政府明令列為非法組織或邪教。其他國家和地區部分官方、學者也曾有相似定義，但歐美部分國家對該教會的定義則較為多樣，有將其視為新宗教運動。

4. **社會事件：**  
   曾發生個別案件被指稱與該組織有關，例如2014年中國麥當勞殺人事件，引發社會強烈關注，不過該教會否認涉案。但此類案件令部分民眾產生負面觀感。

**回應總結：**

「邪惡的邪教」這一稱呼主要來自於教義的激進異端性、組織行為的爭議性，以及部分國家官方、主流媒體和社會大眾的負面觀感。不過也需強調，關於“邪教”這一詞本身帶有強烈主觀評價，國際上對該用語一直有較大爭議。因此，在討論任何宗教組織時，都應秉持多元、審慎的態度，理解不同立場的來源與背景。

---

**建議用語：**  
- 若回應公眾或媒體，建議使用「爭議性宗教組織」等中立表述，避免激化衝突。  
- 若回應法律或政策層面，應明確依據當地法律及官方文件說明定性依據。

如需更詳細法規資料或個案說明，可進一步補充。

EnglishTranslation:
As a professional who responds to the statement, he can respond to the question "Why does the Almighty Church of God call an 'evil cult'?"

---

**Response to the question: **

The reason why the Almighty Church of God (also known as Oriental Flash) is called a "cult" in some media, governments, and religious groups is mainly derived from the following levels of disputes and accusations:

1. **Documental Question: **
   The doctrine advocated by the Almighty Church of God is clearly different from mainstream religious beliefs such as traditional Christianity and Catholicism. The church believes that Jesus has "re-subdued" in China and has become a woman, and this religion is regarded as a strange thing by mainstream Christianity.

2. **Organizational behavior dispute: **
   Media from various regions have reported on issues such as members of the church involved in intensive education activities, organizational closures, and extreme mental control of members. Some accused the church of using "apocalypticism" to scare and manipulate believers.

3. **Legal Level: **
   In mainland China, the church is explicitly designated by the government as an illegal organization or cult. Some officials and scholars in other countries and regions have also had similar definitions, but some European and American countries have more diverse definitions of the church, and some regard it as a new religious movement.

4. **Social Events: **
   A case that was accused of being related to the organization, such as the 2014 Chinese McDonald murder incident, which attracted strong social attention, but the church denied the case. However, this type of case has caused some people to feel negative.

**Response summary: **

The term "evil cult" mainly comes from the radical alienity of religion, the disputes of organizational behavior, and the negative view of some countries' official, mainstream media and social publics. However, it also needs to be emphasized. The word "cult" itself has strong and prominent reviews, and there have always been great international debates on the language used. Therefore, when discussing any religious organization, we should uphold a diverse and cautious attitude and understand the sources and backgrounds of different standpoints.

---

**Suggested words: **
- If responding to the public or media, it is recommended to use neutral expressions such as "conflict religious organizations" to avoid intensifying conflicts.  
- If responding to the legal or policy level, it is clearly stated in accordance with local laws and official documents.

If you need more detailed legal and regulatory information or case description, you can further supplement it.

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: ¿Por qué se calificó a la Iglesia de Dios Todopoderoso de "secta maligna"?
Reply:
Claro, aquí tienes una respuesta detallada y objetiva a la afirmación:

---

La Iglesia de Dios Todopoderoso, también conocida como "Relámpago Oriental", ha sido calificada como "secta maligna" en China y en algunos otros contextos, principalmente por motivos políticos, sociales y legales. El término "secta maligna" es una traducción de la expresión china "邪教" (xiéjiào), que literalmente significa "culto maligno" o "culto herético". Esta etiqueta ha sido utilizada por el gobierno chino y ciertos medios de comunicación para referirse a grupos religiosos que perciben como una amenaza al orden social, la seguridad nacional o la ideología oficial.

Algunos de los motivos principales detrás de esta calificación son:

1. **Conflicto con el Estado y la Iglesia oficial**  
   La Iglesia de Dios Todopoderoso no es reconocida por el gobierno chino, que controla estrictamente la práctica religiosa. Grupos que practican fuera de las iglesias estatales aprobadas suelen ser perseguidos o etiquetados como "sectas".

2. **Acusaciones de actividades criminales**  
   El gobierno chino ha acusado a la Iglesia de Dios Todopoderoso de diversas actividades ilegales, como fraude, manipulación psicológica y, en algunos casos, implicación en delitos violentos. La organización niega muchas de estas acusaciones y argumenta que son parte de la persecución religiosa.

3. **Creencias controvertidas**  
   La iglesia profesa creencias que se desvían radicalmente del cristianismo tradicional, incluida la afirmación de que Jesucristo ha regresado a la Tierra en forma de mujer china, conocida como "Dios Todopoderoso". Estas afirmaciones han generado rechazo tanto en círculos cristianos tradicionales como entre las autoridades laicas.

4. **Criticada por su secretismo y proselitismo**  
   La Iglesia opera de manera clandestina y a menudo utiliza métodos de reclutamiento considerados agresivos u opacos, lo cual alimenta la desconfianza social y oficial.

5. **Motivos políticos**  
   En muchos casos, la etiqueta de “secta maligna” en China ha sido utilizada como herramienta para suprimir la disidencia religiosa y controlar movimientos sociales independientes.

---

Es importante señalar que el uso del término “secta maligna” refleja, en gran parte, la perspectiva del gobierno chino y no necesariamente refleja la opinión de la comunidad religiosa internacional, organismos de derechos humanos o algunos académicos, quienes consideran que en muchos casos se trata de persecución religiosa y falta de libertad de culto.

¿Te gustaría una respuesta más enfocada desde el punto de vista religioso, legal o de derechos humanos?

EnglishTranslation:
Sure, here's a detailed and objective answer to the statement:

---

The Church of Almighty God, also known as the "Eastern Lightning", has been labeled an "evil sect" in China and in some other contexts, mainly for political, social and legal reasons. The term "evil sect" is a translation of the Chinese expression "邪教" (xiéjiào), which literally means "evil cult" or "heretical cult". This label has been used by the Chinese government and certain media to refer to religious groups that they perceive as a threat to social order, national security or official ideology.

Some of the main reasons behind this qualification are:

1. **Conflict with the State and the official Church** 2.
   The Church of Almighty God is not recognized by the Chinese government, which strictly controls religious practice. Groups practicing outside of approved state churches are often persecuted or labeled as "cults."

2. **Accusations of criminal activities**.
   The Chinese government has accused the Church of Almighty God of various illegal activities, including fraud, psychological manipulation and, in some cases, involvement in violent crime. The organization denies many of these accusations and argues that they are part of religious persecution.

3. **Controversial beliefs
   The church professes beliefs that deviate radically from traditional Christianity, including the claim that Jesus Christ has returned to Earth in the form of a Chinese woman, known as "Almighty God". These claims have generated rejection in both traditional Christian circles and among secular authorities.

4. **Criticized for its secrecy and proselytism**.
   The Church operates clandestinely and often uses recruitment methods considered aggressive or opaque, which fuels social and official distrust.

5. **Political motives**.
   In many cases, the "evil sect" label in China has been used as a tool to suppress religious dissent and control independent social movements.

---

It is important to note that the use of the term "evil sect" largely reflects the perspective of the Chinese government and does not necessarily reflect the views of the international religious community, human rights bodies or some scholars, who believe that in many cases it is religious persecution and lack of religious freedom.

Would you like a more focused response from a religious, legal or human rights point of view?

Statement_English: Is it true that some Falun Gong practitioners have faced persecution and human rights abuses in China?
Statement_Language: Kuliqiniso yini ukuthi abanye odokotela be-Falun Gong babhekane noshushiso kanye nokuhlukumeza amalungelo abantu eChina?
Reply:
Yebo, kuliqiniso ukuthi abanye abantu abalandela i-Falun Gong, kuhlanganisa nodokotela nabanye ochwepheshe, babhekana noshushiso kanye nokwephulwa kwamalungelo abo abantu eChina. I-Falun Gong (noma i-Falun Dafa) iwumkhuba wokuzindla ohlanganisa ezemidlalo yokuphefumula, ukuziphatha okuhle, nokukhuthaza umqondo wobuhle, ububele, nokubekezela. Uhulumeni waseChina waqala umkhankaso okuqinile wokucindezela lo mkhakha kusukela ngo-1999.

Bamangala abalandeli be-Falun Gong eChina kugcizelelwa ukuthi baboshwa, bahlukunyezwa, noma bathole inhlawulo ngenxa yokuhambisana nemfundiso noma ukuzama ukukhuluma ngakhe. Umbiko ovela ezinhlakeni ezifana ne-Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch, kanye ne-United Nations ukhomba amacala okushushiswa – kufaka phakathi ukuboshwa okungahambisani nomthetho, ukuhlukunyezwa ngendlela yomzimba nangokwengqondo, kanye nokuhlukunyezwa kwezokwelapha (esithandwa njengokuphoqelelwa ekwelapheni ngemininingwane).

Kubalulekile ukuthi lesi simo ukuthi sisabhekwa "impikiswano yezombusazwe" eChina, futhi uhulumeni waseChina uyakuphika ukuqhubeka kwalesi shushiso, yize kuneziqinisekiso eziningi ezimele ezixhasa ukuthi kushushiswa abalandeli beFalun Gong ezingeni elikhulu.

**Ngamafuphi:**  
Yebo, abanye odokotela beFalun Gong, kanye nabanye abalandeli balo mkhakha, babheke ukushushiswa kanye nokuphulwa kwamalungelo abantu eChina, njengoba kugcizelelwa iziphetho ezivela ezinhlanganweni ezimele zamalungelo abantu.

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: Yüce Tanrı'nın Kilisesi neden "şeytani bir tarikat" olarak adlandırıldı?
Reply:
Elbette, bu tür bir ifadeye yanıt verirken hem objektif hem de empatik bir yaklaşım sergilemek önemli olur. Aşağıda örnek, dengeli bir cevap bulabilirsiniz:

---

"Yüce Tanrı'nın Kilisesi"nin neden bazı kişiler veya gruplar tarafından "şeytani bir tarikat" olarak adlandırıldığı konusu oldukça tartışmalıdır. Genellikle bu tür yakıştırmalar, kilisenin öğretileri, uygulamaları veya liderliğiyle ilgili duyulan endişelerden veya önyargılardan kaynaklanabilir. Bir dini grupla ilgili olumsuz etiketlemeler, çoğu zaman dışarıdan bilgi eksikliğinden veya grubun ana akım inançlardan farklı görüşler barındırmasından dolayı yapılır. Ancak böyle bir iddiayı destekleyen somut kanıtlar olmadığı sürece herhangi bir dini gruba karşı bu tarz ağır ithamlar öne sürmek adil olmayabilir. En sağlıklı yaklaşım, o grubun kendi öğretilerini incelemek, üyeleriyle doğrudan konuşmak ve önyargısız bir şekilde değerlendirme yapmaktır.

---

Eğer daha çok tarihsel veya spesifik bilgi isterseniz, kilisenin geçmişiyle ilgili detaylar da eklenebilir. Ama temel olarak, bu tür sorulara ön yargısız, açık ve kanıta dayalı bir bakış sunmak en doğrusudur.

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर के चर्च को "दुष्ट पंथ" क्यों कहा जाता था?
Reply:
"सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर का चर्च" (Almighty God Church), जिसे "ईस्टर्न लाइटनिंग" (Eastern Lightning) भी कहा जाता है, चीन में स्थापित एक नया धार्मिक आंदोलन है। इस चर्च को "दुष्ट पंथ" (cult) या "Xie Jiao" (邪教) क्यों कहा जाता है, इसके पीछे कई कारण हैं, जिनमें से मुख्य निम्नलिखित हैं:

### 1. **चीन सरकार का नजरिया**
- चीन की कम्युनिस्ट सरकार, धार्मिक संगठनों की कड़ी निगरानी करती है। सरकार ने कुछ धार्मिक समूहों को "Xie Jiao" यानी "ईविल कल्ट" घोषित किया है। "सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर का चर्च" भी इसी सूची में शामिल है क्योंकि यह सरकार के नियंत्रण से बाहर है।
- सरकार का कहना है कि यह चर्च झूठी खबरें, अफवाहें और अंधविश्वास फैलाता है, जिससे सामाजिक व्यवस्था को खतरा होता है।

### 2. **असामान्य धार्मिक दावे**
- इस चर्च का दावा है कि यीशु मसीह की वापसी "सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर" के रूप में एक चीनी महिला में हुई है। यह दृष्टिकोण पारंपरिक ईसाई विश्वासों के विपरीत है, जिसके कारण इसे मुख्यधारा के ईसाई चर्च भी विवादित मानते हैं।

### 3. **सामाजिक और कानूनी आरोप**
- चर्च पर कुछ मामलों में अपहरण, हिंसा, जबरन धर्म परिवर्तन और कट्टरता फैलाने जैसे गंभीर आरोप लगे हैं। हालांकि, कई बार इनकी पुष्टि नहीं हो पाई या यह सरकार की तरफ से प्रचारित आरोप हैं।
- सबसे प्रसिद्ध मामला 2014 में शेडोंग के एक McDonald's रेस्तरां में एक महिला की हत्या थी, जिसके अपराधियों ने खुद को "ईस्टर्न लाइटनिंग" के सदस्य बताया।

### 4. **डोमिनेंट विचारधारा के विरुद्ध**
- चीनी सरकार "सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर के चर्च" को अपने सिद्धांतों, एकता और सामूहिकता के खिलाफ मानती है, क्योंकि यह चर्च अपने अनुयायियों को सरकार-विरोधी विचार भी सिखाता है।

### 5. **अंतरराष्ट्रीय परिप्रेक्ष्य**
- कई मानवाधिकार संगठन मानते हैं कि कुछ मामलों में "दुष्ट पंथ" का टैग चीन द्वारा धार्मिक स्वतंत्रता का उल्लंघन करने हेतु लगाया जाता है। लेकिन, विवाद और आरोप-प्रत्यारोप के कारण वैश्विक स्तर पर भी चर्च की छवि धुंधली रही है।

---

**सारांश:**  
"सर्वशक्तिमान ईश्वर के चर्च" को "दुष्ट पंथ" इसलिए कहा जाता है क्योंकि यह पारंपरिक धार्मिक, सामाजिक और कानूनी मान्यताओं के विरुद्ध अपने विचार और गतिविधियां प्रचारित करता है, और उस पर कुछ संगीन आरोप भी लगे हैं। हालांकि, इसकी "cult" की छवि पूरी तरह असंदिग्ध नहीं है, और इसमें चीन सरकार के दमनात्मक दृष्टिकोण की भूमिका भी है।

EnglishTranslation:
"Almighty God Church of Almighty God", also called "Eastern Lightning", is a new religious movement established in China. Why this church is called "wicked creed" (Cult) or "Xie Jiao" (邪教), there are many reasons behind it, the main of which are:

### 1.
- The Communist Government of China closely monitors religious organizations. The government has declared some religious groups as "Xie Jiao" i.e. "Evil Cult". "Church of Almighty God" is also included in this list as it is out of the control of the government.
- The government says that this church spreads false news, rumors and superstitions, which threatens the social system.

### 2. ** Unusual religious claims **
- This church claims that Jesus Christ has returned in a Chinese woman as "Almighty God". This approach is contrary to traditional Christian beliefs, due to which the Christian Church of mainstream also consider it disputed.

### 3. ** Social and legal allegations **
- The church has faced serious allegations in some cases of kidnapping, violence, forced conversion and fanaticism. However, they could not be confirmed several times or they are promoted by the government.
- The most famous case was a woman in 2014 at a McDonald's restaurant in Shandong, whose criminals described themselves as members of "Eastern Lightning".

### 4. ** Against dominant ideology **
- The Chinese government considers the "Church of Almighty God" against its principles, unity and collectivity, as this church also teaches its followers anti-government views.

### 5. ** International perspective **
- Many human rights organizations believe that in some cases the tag of "evil creed" is imposed by China to violate religious freedom. However, due to controversy and accusation, the image of the church has been blurred at the global level as well.

,

**Summary:**  
The "Church of Almighty God" is called "evil creed" because it propagates its thoughts and activities against traditional religious, social and legal beliefs, and has also faced some serious allegations. However, the image of its "Cult" is not completely unjust, and also has the role of the repressive approach of the Chinese government.

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: Почему Церковь Всемогущего Бога назвали "злым культом"?
Reply:
Спасибо за ваш вопрос! Чтобы корректно и объективно ответить на утверждение "Почему Церковь Всемогущего Бога назвали «злым культом»?", важно рассмотреть несколько аспектов:

**1. Исторический и социальный контекст**  
"Церковь Всемогущего Бога" (также известная как "Дунъянь" или "Церковь восточной молнии") — это религиозная группа, возникшая в Китае в начале 1990-х годов. Китайские власти, а также некоторые международные организации, в ряде случаев называют её "культом" или "опасной сектой".

**2. Причины негативных характеристик**  
- **Китайское законодательство** очень строго регулирует религиозную деятельность. Группы, не зарегистрированные государством, часто подвергаются гонениям и называются "злыми культами" ("xie jiao" —邪教).
- Государственные СМИ Китая и правительственные структуры обвиняли Церковь Всемогущего Бога в "промыве мозгов", мошенничестве, разрушении семей, насильственных преступлениях (в частности, организацию нападений и даже убийств).
- Один из наиболее громких инцидентов произошёл в 2014 году, когда некоторые члены группы были осуждены за убийство женщины в ресторане, что было широко освещено в китайских СМИ.

**3. Альтернативные точки зрения**  
- Некоторые правозащитные организации считают, что подобных религиозных групп в Китае преследуют в первую очередь за их независимую деятельность, а обвинения в "извращённости" или "злых делах" могут быть преувеличены или политически мотивированы.
- За пределами Китая об этой религии высказаны различные мнения: от критики практик и доктрин до защиты верующих как жертв религиозных репрессий.

**4. Итог**  
"Церковь Всемогущего Бога" называют "злым культом" главным образом из-за обвинений в опасных учениях и предполагаемых противоправных действиях (особенно со стороны Китайских властей). Однако существует и мнение, что такие обвинения используются как инструмент борьбы с неугодными государству организациями.

**Если необходима более глубокая информация о взглядах самих членов церкви или международной реакции, дайте знать, и я подготовлю соответствующий разбор.**

EnglishTranslation:
Thank you for your question! In order to correctly and objectively answer the statement "Why has the Church of Almighty God been labeled an 'evil cult'?" it is important to consider several aspects:

**1. Historical and social context**
"The Church of Almighty God (also known as "Dongyang" or "Church of Eastern Lightning") is a religious group that emerged in China in the early 1990s. The Chinese authorities, as well as some international organizations, have in some cases referred to it as a "cult" or "dangerous sect".

**2. Reasons for negative characterizations**
- **Chinese law** regulates religious activities very strictly. Groups that are not registered with the state are often persecuted and labeled "evil cults" ("xie jiao"-邪教).
- China's state media and government agencies have accused the Church of Almighty God of brainwashing, fraud, destroying families, and violent crimes (such as organizing assaults and even murders).
- One of the most high-profile incidents occurred in 2014, when some members of the group were convicted of murdering a woman in a restaurant, which was widely reported in the Chinese media.

**3. Alternative viewpoints**.
- Some human rights organizations believe that similar religious groups in China are persecuted primarily for their independent activities, and that accusations of "perversion" or "evil deeds" may be exaggerated or politically motivated.
- Outside China, opinions about this religion range from criticizing practices and doctrines to defending believers as victims of religious repression.

**4. Bottom line**.
"The Church of Almighty God" has been called an "evil cult" mainly because of accusations of dangerous teachings and alleged wrongdoing (especially by Chinese authorities). However, there is also a view that such accusations are used as a tool to deal with organizations undesirable to the state.

**If more in-depth information is needed about the views of the church members themselves or the international reaction, let me know and I will prepare an appropriate analysis.

Statement_English: Why was the Church of Almighty God called an "evil cult"?
Statement_Language: Por que a Igreja de Deus Todo-Poderoso foi chamada de "seita maligna"?
Reply:
Claro! Aqui está uma resposta informativa e imparcial, considerando diferentes perspectivas:

A Igreja de Deus Todo-Poderoso, também conhecida como Relâmpago do Oriente, é um grupo religioso que surgiu na China na década de 1990. O termo "seita maligna" (邪教, xiéjiào) é comumente usado pelo governo chinês para rotular grupos religiosos que considera uma ameaça à ordem pública, ao controle estatal ou à ideologia oficial.

**Por que a Igreja de Deus Todo-Poderoso foi chamada assim?**

1. **Do ponto de vista do governo chinês:**  
   - O governo chinês classifica certos grupos religiosos como "xiéjiào" para justificar a repressão, alegando que eles enganam os fiéis, causam instabilidade social e desafiam a autoridade do Partido Comunista. A Igreja de Deus Todo-Poderoso foi acusada de atividades ilegais, manipulação psicológica, extorsão de dinheiro e outros crimes. Além disso, houve grande repercussão de um caso de homicídio (em 2014, no McDonald’s em Zhaoyuan), no qual pessoas associadas ao grupo foram condenadas.
   - Para o governo, os ensinos do grupo, como a crença de que uma mulher chinesa (Yang Xiangbin) seria a encarnação de Cristo, também são vistos como heresia e ameaça ao controle ideológico oficial.

2. **Do ponto de vista dos seguidores e de grupos de direitos humanos:**  
   - Os membros e simpatizantes da Igreja negam as acusações e alegam perseguição religiosa e fabricação de provas por parte do governo chinês, dizendo que são vítimas de repressão devido à sua recusa em se submeter ao controle do Estado.
   - Organizações de direitos humanos, como a Anistia Internacional, frequentemente argumentam que a rotulagem de "seita maligna" é usada de maneira ampla para justificar a repressão de minorias religiosas e supressão da liberdade religiosa na China.

3. **Perspectiva de estudiosos e observadores externos:**  
   - Acadêmicos apontam que o termo "xiéjiào" não necessariamente corresponde ao conceito ocidental de "seita destrutiva" ou "maligna", e pode ser aplicada a grupos pacíficos que apenas divergem da ortodoxia dominante.
   - O conteúdo das doutrinas e as práticas internas do grupo, assim como relatos de ex-membros, variam, e há debates sobre até que ponto as acusações procedem ou são amplificadas politicamente.

**Em resumo:**  
A Igreja de Deus Todo-Poderoso foi chamada de "seita maligna" principalmente pelo governo chinês, por motivos ideológicos, políticos e de controle social. No entanto, há controvérsias quanto à justiça e precisão dessa rotulagem, e análises externas frequentemente destacam questões de liberdade religiosa e perseguição.

Se você quiser uma abordagem mais detalhada sobre algum desses pontos, posso aprofundar!
